attributes.action: Reinstate Funding for Projects Tackling Bullying of LGBT Students in Schools
attributes.additional_details:
“The government itself has admitted that young people who identify as LGBT have higher risk of bullying and long-term harm to their education, health and wellbeing, so to be pulling away financial support from those fighting this abuse is especially callous.”

The government decided to cut the £4 million funding on anti-bullying week while also announcing £16.5 billion in military spending. If the government wants to support LGBT rights and equality across the country, schools need to be helped.
attributes.background: The Homophobic, Biphobic and Transphobic Challenge Fund allowed teachers, staff and students to receive free workshops and training to effectively tackle anti-LGBT bullying. This funding needs to be reinstated in order to protect students' education, emotional well-being and mental health.
